title: Understanding Random Errors
text: Random errors are caused by unpredictable fluctuations in the measurement process. They can arise from environmental changes, slight variations in measurement technique, or inherent noise in the measurement system.

title: Characteristics of Random Errors
text: Random errors are typically characterized by their lack of consistency. They can cause measurements to be higher or lower than the true value, and they tend to average out over multiple measurements.

title: Identifying Random Errors
text: Which type of error is caused by unpredictable fluctuations in measurement?
